authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
description: Schapelle Corby appears to be enjoying her last months in Bali swimming at the beach, running, and seeing her Balinese boyfriend, before returning home when her parole for drug smuggling ends.
title: Schapelle Corby's charmed life in Bali before coming home
title_page: Schapelle Corby's charmed life in Bali before coming home | Daily Mail Online
text:
Schapelle Corby appears to be enjoying her last months in Bali before returning home when her parole for drug smuggling ends in May.
Parole officers in December admitted they had no idea where the 39-year-old was living even though they were meant to be keeping an eye on her.
But she has been spotted enjoying a charmed life of leisure on the Indonesian island after she was released from Kerobokan Prison in February 2014.
Scroll down for video
Schapelle Corby appears to be enjoying her last months in Bali before returning home when her parole for drug smuggling ends in May
The 39-year-old was spotted running to keep fit and riding around the island on a scooter
The former Gold Coast beauty therapist was pictured swimming at a 'secret' beach every day and driving around Bali on a scooter in an upcoming promotional advertisement for 9 News report.
She was also spotted going for regular runs to keep fit and shopping in popular Indonesian dress while shading her eyes with oversized sunglasses.
The segment preview also showed her beefy, tattooed Balinese boyfriend of 10 years Ben Panangian sitting in a yellow car in a singlet and shorts.
It also claimed to show how Corby was preparing to return to Australia, where she is expected to live with her sister Mercedes and children Wayan, 17, Nyeleigh, 15, and Nyoman, 9.
The segment preview also purported to show her beefy, tattooed Balinese boyfriend sitting in a yellow car in a singlet and shorts
Corby was arrested trying to smuggle 4.2 kilograms of marijuana in her boogie board bag from Australia in October 2004, and jailed the following year
She was supposed to stay with Mercedes' ex-husband Wayan Widyartha in his Kuta compound while on parole, but locals claimed she never lived there.
Wayan also closed down his nearby surf shop Kuta Board Room and moved elsewhere, though it was not clear if Corby was with him.
Corby was arrested trying to smuggle 4.2 kilograms of marijuana in her boogie board bag from Australia in October 2004.
She was convicted the following year, but maintained her innocence.
Her parole ends in July and she can leave Indonesia to return to Australia on May 27.
Corby with her sister Mercedes on the night she was released on parole in February 2014
